title: Bunny Friend playground shooting suspect surrenders
content:
NEW ORLEANS —
A man surrendered to authorities Friday after a mass shooting last month at a playground in the Ninth Ward.
Four more people were identified as suspects in the shooting earlier Friday.
The shooting happened Nov. 22 at the playground in the 1900 block of Gallier Street. Seventeen people were injured.
Lawrence "L" Veals, 19, surrendered at New Orleans police headquarters and is being questioned.
Police continue to search for Quendrick "C4" Bailey, 20, Michael “Mack” Allen, 29, and Rashad "KMG EZZY" Walker, 22.
Once apprehended, the men will be booked and charged with 17 counts of attempted first-degree murder.
On Nov. 27, detectives identified Joseph “Moe” Allen, 32, as one of the suspects involved in the incident. Allen turned himself into NOPD the next day. He refused to provide a statement to detectives, police said. He remains in custody.
Police believe several other people were involved in the incident and are asking the public to come forward with any information that will lead to the identification and arrest of the remaining shooters.
Anyone with information is asked to call Crimestoppers at 504-822-1111 or Fifth District detectives at 504-658-6050.
